Boston tentatively plans ‘hybrid’ approach for fallStudents in Boston will likely attend school in-person a couple of days a week this fall on a rotating basis. On the days they don’t attend brick-and-mortar classes, they would learn from home, said Tammy Pust, a senior adviser to Boston’s superintendent of schools.
